sentences: Lindi Ortega (born May 28, 1980) is a Canadian country singer-songwriter from Toronto, Ontario, who  had lived in Nashville, Tennessee then married and moved to Western Canada in 2017.
Lindi Ortega (born May 28, 1980) is a Canadian country singer-songwriter from Toronto, Ontario, who  had lived in Nashville, Tennessee then married and moved to Western Canada in 2017.
She spent nearly a decade as an independent artist in the Toronto music scene, releasing two albums and an EP in that time.
Ortega left Last Gang management and records in November 2017.
At the end of 2010 and beginning of 2011, Ortega toured extensively as a backup singer for Brandon Flowers, the lead singer of the Killers, in support of his solo album, Flamingo.
At the end of 2010 and beginning of 2011, Ortega toured extensively as a backup singer for Brandon Flowers, the lead singer of the Killers, in support of his solo album, Flamingo.

The tour included dates in the United States, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Italy, Spain and Mexico, as well as televised live performances on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, Jimmy Kimmel Live!, Later ... with Jools Holland and at Abbey Road Studios.
On February 7, 2012, Ortega was nominated for two Juno Awards – New Artist of the Year and Roots & Traditional Album: Solo.
On February 7, 2012, Ortega was nominated for two Juno Awards – New Artist of the Year and Roots & Traditional Album: Solo.

"Ortega spent years trawling around record labels as the Toronto scene dubbed her "Indie Lindi".
In 2008, she signed to major label Interscope, releasing one EP before they directed their resources into something more conventionally radio-friendly.
"After a decade of making ends meet by working in pizza places and fleamarkets, in 2011, she signed to Last Gang.

On December 29, 2016, Ortega announced via Facebook that she was engaged.
In 2018, Ortega revealed that she has suffered from body dysmorphic disorder.
A self-described bird lover, Ortega organised and was the featured performer at a benefit concert for the World Parrot Refuge in Coombs, British Columbia on March 3, 2010.
Ortega's debut album, The Taste of Forbidden Fruit, was released in 2001.

After being signed to Cherrytree Records / Interscope Records in August 2008 Ortega released her second EP, The Drifter E.P., to critical success.

In September 2009 Ortega performed on a cross-Canada tour as opening act for Keane's North American tour.
Ortega announced on her blog that a new full-length album with Juno Award winning producer, Ron Lopata, would be released on June 7, 2011 on Last Gang.
A release party was held at The Dakota Tavern in Toronto on June 6, 2011.
In December 2011, Ortega moved to Nashville, TN where she began working with producer Colin Linden to record her album Cigarettes & Truckstops.
The album was released on Last Gang Records on October 2, 2012.

Ortega released her third album for Last Gang, Tin Star, on October 8, 2013.
Ortega released her fourth full-length album, Faded Gloryville, on Last Gang Records' imprint Grand Tour Records on August 7, 2015.
Ortega released Liberty, her fifth full-length album, on Shadowbox Music on March 30, 2018.
